dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool will be used to build Derived Mosaic dataset. The tool takes as input a Configuration file as a compulsary parameter. Other parameters are optional. If other parameters are defined as input for this tool, then they will take precedence over the values defined in the Configuration file

tool.name: DerivedMD

param.name: Configuration File
param.dialogReference: Path to the Configuration File that will be used for building the Mosaic Dataset (except where inputs to this tool take precedence).

param.name: command
param.dialogReference:
List of the Commands that need to be run on the Mosaic dataset. The List of the commands that can be used are represented by these two letter codes:

  • CM = Create Mosaic Datasets.

  • AF = Add Fields.

  • AR = Add Rasters.

  • CR = Create Referenced MDs.

  • BF = Build Footprints.

  • BB = Build Boundary.

  • IF = Import Fields.

  • IG = Import Geometry.

  • DN = Define NoData values.

  • SP = Set Properties.

  • SS = Set Statistics.

  • CC = Calculate Cell size ranges.

  • BO = Build Overviews.

  • DO = Define Overviews.

  • AI = Add Index.

  • CV = Calculate Values.

  • BP = Build Pyramids.

Multiple Commands can be merged with "+" sign. For example, Creation of a Mosaic Dataset followed by Add Fields is represented as CM+AF. IMPORTANT: Commands are executed in the sequence entered in this list box

param.name: Path to the geodatabase
param.dialogReference: The path and name of a geodatabase where the Mosaic Dataset will be created. Note - this tool will not CREATE a geodatabase, so it must exist prior to execution.

param.name: Input Data Path
param.dialogReference: Path and name of Mosaic Dataset that will be input to this Derived Mosaic Dataset.

tool.summary: This tool will be used to build Derived Mosaic dataset. The tool takes as input a Configuration file as a compulsary parameter. Other parameters are optional. If other parameters are defined as input for this tool, then they will take precedence over the values defined in the Configuration file
